gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy husYnI bD kiRpwl ihMmq sMgqIAw bD brnnM nwm igAwrmo iDAwie smwpq msqu suB msqu ]11] APjU ]423]
transliteration: It(i) Sroo Bachitra Naatak Granthe Housainoo Badh Kridaal Hinmat Sanadooaa Badh Barnanan Naam Giaarmo Dhiaae Samaapat Mast(u) Soubh Mast(u)||11||afjoo||423||
translation: End of Eleventh Chapter of BACHITTAR NATAK entitled Description of the Killing of Hussaini and also the Killing of Kirpal, Himmat and Sangatia.11.423

gurmukhi: ju`D BXo ieh BwNiq Apwrw ] qurkn ko mwirE isrdwrw ]
transliteration: Juddh Bhayo Eh Bhaant(i) Apaaraa|| Turkan Ko Maario Sirdaaraa||
translation: In this way, the great battle was fought, when the leader of the Turks (Muhammedans) was killed.

gurmukhi: irs qn Kwn idlwvr qey ] ieqY saUr pTwvq Bey ]1]
transliteration: Ris Tan Khaan Dilaavar Tae|| Itai Saoor Pathaavat Bhae||1||
translation: On this Dilawar become very angry and sent a contingent of horsemen in this direction.1.

gurmukhi: auqY piTE aun isMG juJwrw ] iqh Blwn qy Kyd inkwrw ]
transliteration: Outai Pathio Oun Singh Jujhaaraa|| Tin Bhalaan Te Khed Nikaaraa||
translation: From the other side, Jujhar Singh was sent, who drove out the enemy from Bhallan immediately.

gurmukhi: ieiq gj isMG pMmw dl jorw ] Dwie pry iqn aUpr Byrw ]2]
transliteration: It(i) Gad Singh Panmaa Dal Joraa|| Dhaae Dare Tin Oopar Bhoraa||2||
translation: On this side Gaj Singh and Pamma (Parmanand) assembled their forces and fell upon them early in the morning.2.

gurmukhi: auqY juJwr isMG BXo Awfw ] ijm rn KMB BUim rin gwfw ]
transliteration: Outai Jujhaar Singh Bhayo Aadaa|| Jim Ran Khanbh Bhoom(i) Ran(i) Gaddaa||
translation: On the other side Jujhar Singh stood firmly like a flagpost planted in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: gwfw cly n hwfw cil hY ] swmuih syl smr mo Jil hY ]3]
transliteration: Gaddaa Chale Na Haadaa Chal(i) Hai|| Saamuh(i) Sel Samar Mo Jhal(i) Hai||3||
translation: Even the flagpost might be loosened, but the brave Rajput did not waver, he received the blows without flinching.3.

gurmukhi: bwt cVHY dl doaU juJwrw ] auqY cMdyl ieqY jsvwrw ]
transliteration: Baat Chadhai Dal Dooo Jujhaaraa|| Outai Channdel Itai Jasvaaraa||
translation: The warriors of both armies moved in detachments, Raja of Chandel on that side and Raja of Jaswar on this side.

gurmukhi: mMifE bIr Kyq mo ju`Dw ] aupijau smrsUr mn kRu`Dw ]4]
transliteration: Mandio Boor Khet Mo Juddhaa|| Oupjio Samarsoor Man Kruddhaa||4||
translation: All the warriors were in great rage and the fight began in the battlefield.4.

gurmukhi: kop Bry doaU ids Bt Bwry ] ieqY cMdyl auqY jsvwry ]
transliteration: Kop Bhare Dooo Dis Bhat Bhdare|| Itai Channdel Outai Jasvdare||
translation: The brave heroes of both the armies were in great anger, warriors of Chandel on this side and warriors of Jaswar on the other.

gurmukhi: Fol ngwry bjy Apwrw ] BIm rUp BYro BBkwrw ]5]
transliteration: Dhol Nagdare Bade Apaaraa|| Bhoom Roop Bhairo Bhabhkaaraa||5||
translation: Many drums and trumpets resounded, the terrible Bhairo (the god of war) shouted.5.
